description: The auth.sso_domains table represents email domain configurations for Single Sign-On (SSO) authentication, mapping specific email domains to their corresponding SSO Identity Providers. This table serves as a lookup mechanism to determine which SSO provider should handle authentication requests based on a user's email domain. The table appears to be a standalone configuration entity with no direct foreign key relationships, functioning as a reference table within the authentication system.

columns.name: id
columns.description: A unique identifier that distinguishes each single sign-on domain configuration within the authentication system. Purpose unclear from available data due to lack of sample values.

columns.name: sso_provider_id
columns.description: Links each SSO domain configuration to its corresponding single sign-on provider service. This establishes which authentication provider handles login requests for domains in this table.

columns.name: domain
columns.description: Purpose unclear from available data, though this appears to store domain-related information for single sign-on authentication configuration.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: Records the timestamp when a single sign-on domain configuration was first added to the system. Purpose unclear from available data due to lack of sample values.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: Records when an SSO domain configuration was last modified. Purpose unclear from available data due to lack of sample values.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX sso_domains_domain_idx ON auth.sso_domains USING btree (lower(domain))
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX sso_domains_pkey ON auth.sso_domains USING btree (id)
CREATE INDEX sso_domains_sso_provider_id_idx ON auth.sso_domains USING btree (sso_provider_id)
